info.name: API Key Management Service
info.description:
API Key Management Service
This project delivers a production-ready FastAPI application for secure API key management with multi-tenancy, RBAC, rate limiting, webhooks, and audit logging. Key features include project isolation, SHA-256 key storage, granular permission scopes, IP restrictions, and real-time monitoring. The API supports dynamic configuration, sensitive data sanitization, and comprehensive audit trails. Documentation is available via static HTML guides and a complete Postman collection. Designed for scalability and security, it enables robust authentication and authorization workflows for modern SaaS platforms, ensuring compliance and operational transparency for developers and administrators.

item.name: health
liveness

request.description:
Simple liveness check for container orchestration.

Returns 200 if the service is running, regardless of dependencies.
Useful for Kubernetes liveness probes.

Returns:
    JSONResponse: Simple alive status

item.description: Liveness Health Check

item.name: readiness

request.description:
Readiness check for container orchestration.

Returns 200 if the service is ready to accept traffic (database connected).
Returns 503 if not ready. Useful for Kubernetes readiness probes.

Returns:
    JSONResponse: Readiness status

item.description: Readiness Health Check

request.description:
Get API health status.

Returns comprehensive health information including:
- Overall API status
- Version and environment
- Current timestamp and uptime
- Database connection status

Returns:
    HealthResponse: Detailed health information

item.description: Health Check Resource

item.name: bulk

request.description:
📦 Bulk upsert scopes from JSON data for a project

Creates new scopes or updates existing ones based on scope_name.
Validates against JSON schema before processing.

**Features:**
- Create or update multiple scopes in a single request
- Automatic validation against schema
- Detailed result with created/updated/skipped counts
- Error reporting per scope

**Example JSON:**
```json
{
  "scopes": [
    {
      "scope_name": "akm:users:read",
      "description": "Read user data",
      "resource_type": "users",
      "action": "read"
    }
  ]
}
```

📚 **[Full Documentation & Examples](https://github.com/ideiasfactory/akm/blob/main/docs/SCOPES_BULK_INSERT.md)**

item.name: file

request.description:
📄 Bulk upsert scopes from uploaded JSON file for a project

Upload a JSON file with scopes structure and validate against schema.
Useful for importing large scope configurations.

**File Format:** Same JSON structure as the bulk endpoint

📚 **[Full Documentation & Examples](https://github.com/ideiasfactory/akm/blob/main/docs/SCOPES_BULK_INSERT.md)**

item.name: scopes
openapi
analyze

request.description:
Analyze OpenAPI/Swagger specification and preview scope generation.

This endpoint analyzes the spec and returns statistics about what scopes
would be generated for each strategy, without actually generating them.

item.description: Folder for akm / v1 / scopes / openapi / analyze endpoints.

item.name: generate
file

request.description:
Generate scopes from uploaded OpenAPI/Swagger file.

Accepts both JSON and YAML formats.

item.description: Folder for akm / v1 / scopes / openapi / generate / file endpoints.

item.name: url

request.description:
Generate scopes from OpenAPI spec URL.

Example URLs:
- https://petstore3.swagger.io/api/v3/openapi.json
- https://api.example.com/docs/openapi.json
- https://api.example.com/swagger.json

item.description: Folder for akm / v1 / scopes / openapi / generate / url endpoints.

request.description:
Generate scopes from OpenAPI/Swagger specification.

Supports multiple input methods:
- URL: Fetch spec from a URL (e.g., https://api.example.com/openapi.json)
- File: Load spec from uploaded file (use /generate/file endpoint)
- JSON: Provide spec directly in request body

Supports multiple generation strategies:
- path_resource: One scope per resource with CRUD actions (recommended)
- path_method: One scope per path + HTTP method combination
- tag_based: One scope per OpenAPI tag + action
- operation_id: One scope per operationId

item.description: Folder for akm / v1 / scopes / openapi / generate endpoints.

item.name: generate-and-import

request.description:
Generate scopes from OpenAPI spec and optionally import them to database.

This is a convenience endpoint that combines generation and import in one call.
Set import_to_db=false to only generate without importing.

item.description: Folder for akm / v1 / scopes / openapi / generate-and-import endpoints.
